result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad F Kiefer
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: W1135 Spleas Skoney Rd, East Troy, WI 53120

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:42 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Chad F Kiefer in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Chad F Kiefer. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, due to being a late on.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
THE COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2) SUA SPONTE.  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 17th, 2022.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
